{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.16757v1", "title": "Constant-Roll Inflation", "summary": "Constant-roll inflation is a distinctive class of phenomenological
inflationary models in which the inflaton's rate of roll remains constant. It
provides an exact solution that is compatible with the latest observational
constraints and offers a natural framework for enhancing the curvature power
spectrum, which is relevant to the formation of primordial black holes. In this
paper, I review constant-roll inflation in memory of Alexei Starobinsky.", "main_category": "astro-ph.CO", "categories": "astro-ph.CO", "published": "2025-04-23T14:30:06Z"}
